title: Wins?
body:
Just wondering, how many wins should i have under my belt before i start playing ranked seriously?

Btw i main adc if that means anything

replies.body:
I would recommend you play enough games so that you are familiar and comfortable in the match ups for your main  and backup lane. 

 It is also imperative that you are able to play support! Autofill happens and support is usually where players get placed. 

On top of this, I would seriously suggest you look into your runes (as suggested by *Father Time*) as having sub optimal ones put both yourself and your team at a disadvantage as you will likely under perform compared to your laner. 

Here are 3 basic pages that shouldn't cost you too much:

**AD page (cost all up= 8,610 IP)**
Quints (big ones) - 3 x attack damage
Seal (yellow) - 9x armour
Mark (red) - 9 x attack damage
Glyph (blue) - 9 x magic resist

(Often players add some attack speed in their AD pages by replacing the quints with attack speed, this also helps for jungling)

**AP page (cost all up= 10,455 or 12,300 if you go for AP over MP)**
Quints (big ones) - 3 x ability power
Seal (yellow) - 9x armour
Mark (red) - 9 x magic pen
Glyph (blue) - 9 x magic resist or ability power

**Tank page (cost all up= 14,145 IP)**
Quints (big ones)- 3 x armour
Seal (yellow) - 9 x HP
Mark (red) - 9 x armour
Glyph (blue) - 9 x magic resist

> Note: all prices are estimates due to me using a S4 rune calculator

the magic resist blue are 1/2 price, so are ad and ap quint, and ad mark and ap blue

And its more stat efficient to get  attackspeed marks and 3 ad quints, but it cost more ip.
tank pages should generally run attack speed reds

There are quite a [few different tank page configurations](http://team-dignitas.net/articles/blogs/League-of-Legends/8851/season-6-standard-rune-pages) and I linked the one that would be one of the cheaper options. 

Depending on OP's secondary role, he could likely put just about anything onto a tank page and it would work. Generally AS for tank pages is good for junglers and top laners, while a full out conservative approach (as above) is useful for tank supports.

Your pages are messed up. Why would an ADC run pure AD with magic resist instead of armour?

These are incredibly basic pages, generally for beginners. They are just a stepping stone until a player has the confidence and IP to branch further out. 

Ideally you wouldn't run pure AD and instead would substitute the AD quints for AS (like stated in my post). However, if you are a new-ish player and have few rune pages to cover or struggle with CS AD is going to help you get the last hits. 

MR is pretty common, since bot lane is being dictated with heavy AP poke support like Karma and Lulu. In silver/bronze we also see a lot of players picking full AP "supports" like Lux and Brand. Alternatively (but more expensively), you could run scaling MR or 50/50 it. 

The page contains armour seals which are more than sufficient when coupled with masteries to provide some survivability vs the enemy ADC during laning phase (which is where runes and masteries have the most impact).
His rune page is fine for someone new to the role, and you can't run armor glyphs as it gets you next to no armor per rune, also ap supports hurt without mr.
Thank you for the advice, much appreciated
^ and competent at least  at 2 champs in all roles so you don't be one of those... my main got banned wah wah swap or i got autofilled but i only play yasuo mid/top wah wah!
Forget about wins and sort out 2 proper rune pages to begin with, only once you have those should you contemplate ranked
Only think of 'Wins' when you are good enough to start your 2nd smurf! If you are only starting out green, you will find Riot's matching systems dictates which side wins.
